metadata.title: CVE-2023-26590 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A floating point exception vulnerability was found in sox, in thelsx_aiffstartwrite function at sox/src/aiff.c:622:58. This flaw can lead toa denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
libsox2 - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
sox - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm1').
